paper_abstract: The authors exploit the intrinsic error tolerance of emerging Recognition, Mining, and Synthesis (RMS) applications to mitigate variation. RMS applications can tolerate errors emanating from data-intensive program phases rather than control. Thus, the authors reserve reliable cores for control and execute error-tolerant data-intensive phases on error-prone cores. They also provide a design space exploration for decoupled control and data processing to mitigate variation at near-threshold voltages.
paper_title: DECOUPLED CONTROL AND DATA PROCESSING FOR APPROXIMATE NEAR-THRESHOLD VOLTAGE COMPUTING
